name: How Many? Quiz / Test | Topics for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many wheels are on a standard bicycle?
questions.explanation:
2.

	Bi, meaning two, is the hint in that word. A standard bicycle has two wheels. If it has a single wheel it is a unicycle. Bicycles are a good way for children to get exercise.

questions.text: How many eyes does a cyclops have?
questions.explanation:
1.

	A cyclops is a mythical, one-eyed creature. There is also a character in the "X-Men" universe named Cyclops because he is forced to wear a visor making him appear to have a single eye.

questions.text: How many legs does a typical uninjured spider have?
questions.explanation:
8.

	Spiders are in the arachnid family. Members of the arachnid family have eight legs. Bugs with less than eight legs are typically in the insect family or some other classification.

questions.text: How many people compete on an Olympic swimming relay team during the race?
questions.explanation:
4.

	While teams can have more than four members to help them get through the qualifying rounds, only four compete in any given race. Relay teams in athletics track competitions also consist of four athletes.

questions.text: How many turtles were on the original "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles" team?
questions.explanation:
4.

	The four original turtles were Leonardo, Michelangelo, Donatello and Raphael. In much later years they were joined by Venus for a short time. The turtles started as comic book characters and later appeared in just about every form of mass media.

questions.text: How many ounces are in a cup (US, not metric)?
questions.explanation:
8.

	There are eight ounces in a cup. There are four cups in a quart, and four quarts in a gallon. That is how the U.S. measures liquids. Most of the rest of the world uses the metric system.

questions.text: How many weeks are in a standard year?
questions.explanation:
52.

	There are seven days in a week and about 365 days in a standard year. In a leap year there is one extra day making 366 days. Years are divided into 12 months with 28, 30 or 31 days in each. In a leap year, February adds the extra day making 29 days.

questions.text: How many babies are born if a mother has triplets?
questions.explanation:
3.

	Triplets includes the prefix "tri" meaning three. If there are two children born it is called twins. Four offspring from a single birth are quadruplets. Multiple births in mammals can be caused from either multiple eggs being fertilized or from one egg splitting after it is fertilized.

questions.text: About how many bones are in the standard human body at birth?
questions.explanation:
312.

	An adult human typically has 206 bones due to some fusing together as we grow. At birth there are typically more than 300 bones. The human body is typically done with bone fusing by age 30.

questions.text: How many colonies were there when the United States separated from England?
questions.explanation:
13.

	The original 13 colonies were  Delaware, Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Georgia, Connecticut, Massachusetts Bay, Maryland, South Carolina, New Hampshire, Virginia, New York, North Carolina, and Rhode Island and Providence Plantations. They seceded from England in 1776.
